page.title: 10PANGBOURNE B
page.content:
Grid ref.: 6375 Land Use : Part residential, river and meadows. The river flows beside the A340. A footpath leads to a stile which faces a small footbridge; this part has licensed private fishing; the fish include rainbow trout, brown trout and grayling. The thick undergrowth along the river is full of water rats and dragonflies. {THE MONKS REST}is an old house with a thatched roof situated at the end of Green Lane. The monks from {Reading {Abbey}came here to rest on their way to Bere Court for the summer. Grid Ref.: 6275 Land Use: Very large residential and stud farms: grassland.
It is mostly a residential area
